properties.areaDesc: South Central Oregon Cascades; Siskiyou Mountains and Southern Oregon Cascades
properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 20 at 5:42PM PST until January 21 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Medford OR
properties.description:
* WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of up to 6
inches. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph.

* WHERE...South Central Oregon Cascades, Southern Oregon Cascades
and Siskiyou Mountains including Union Creak and Diamond Lake.
This includes Highways 62, 138, 230, portions of Highway 140
near Lake of the Woods Pass, and portions of Highway 66.

* WHEN...From 4 AM to 10 AM PST Tuesday.

* IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous
conditions could impact the morning commute. Heavy snow with
gusty winds could bring down tree branches.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow levels may rise at the onset, but
should fall rapidly to near 3500 feet when the heavier snow
fall occurs, between 7 AM and 10 AM.

* View the hazard area in detail at
https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/mfr/HAZARD
properties.instruction:
* Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination.

* Carry tire chains and be prepared for snow covered roads and
limited visibilities.

* See https://www.tripcheck.com for latest road conditions.

* A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means that periods of snow
will cause travel difficulties.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 4 AM TO 10 AM PST TUESDAY
